terms.term: Controls are actions or things (i.e. processes or measures) that are put in place to eliminate or minimise the hazard and hence, the risk.

This induction applies to all employees and contractors working for the Queensland Government regardless of whether they are permanent, temporary, full-time, part-time or casual employees, volunteers and/or on secondment. This policy also applies to all students gaining work experience in a Queensland Government workplace, including members of the public. For the purposes of this policy, the term contractor includes on-hired temporary labour services (agency staff) and sub-contractors.’
Hazard is something with the potential to cause harm. This can include substance (both hazardous or dangerous), plant, work process and/or other aspects of the work environment.

Incident is an occurrence or event, or an action likely to lead to grave consequences. For example, reversing into another vehicle, hitting a bollard, reversing into a wall, or colliding with another vehicle.

Injury is damage or harm caused to the structure or function of the body caused by an outside agent or force, which may be physical or chemical. Injury may also refer to injured feelings or reputation rather than injuries to the body.

Near miss is defined as a motor vehicle occurrence that did not result in any known incident (damage, liability and/or injury), but had the potential to do so e.g. nearly hitting a pedestrian, missed a kangaroo, went through a red light, speeding (receiving a ticket).
Risk refers to the likelihood (probability) that a hazard will cause injury or damage.

Risk management is a systematic method used to control the risk of incidents resulting from hazards. The aim of risk management is to reduce the likelihood and severity of incidents, injury or damage resulting from specific activities.

Workplace is a place where work is carried out for a business or undertaking, and includes any place where a worker goes, or is likely to be, while at work. A vehicle used for work purposes is described as a workplace under the Work Health and Safety Act 2011.
